newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Oct 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Oct 29.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Manin opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) is planning to announce a shadow cabinet shortly in conformity with the parliamentary system, party Secretary-General Abdul Mannan Bhuiyan said.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, now on a visit to USA, said on Monday her government was not willing to "internationalise" the Ganges water issue when bilateral negotiations with India were on.
Water Resourcs Minister Abdur Razzak left Dhaka on Monday night for New Delhi to resume talks on sharing of Ganges water with Indian leaders.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina told a group of U.S. portfolio investors in New York that her government wanted to remove bureaucratic road-blocks to encourage foreign investment.
Commerce and Industries Minister Tofael Ahmed left Dhaka on Monday for Rangoon to talk with Burmese leaders on promotion of business ties between Bangladesh and Burma.

Ssangyong Corporation, a top South Korean company, has teamed up with Bangladesh's Summit Group to set up a $20 million plant for bottling liquified petroleum gas (LPG) in the country's south-western Khulna region.
